channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Long term skip causing blight and antisocial issues, 29th August
item.description:
A skip has been on the road at this position for most of 2025 with minimal work being completed at the residence, blocking two parking spaces on a road that already has shortages of spaces - especially as the students return. People are dumping random waste, animals are searching it and others rubbish is being dumped on the road around it. It is a hugely unreasonable length of time and is causing issues for the local residents - please can it be urgently removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Marle Hill Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over-tall trees are dangerous in high winds, 29th August
item.description:
On the right hand side of the first 100m of the footpath behind Mead Road there are some very tall trees. They sit between the footpath and Travis Perkins. In high winds they look very unstable and each winter they look more unstable with the summer's growth. We've lived here 12 years and they have at least doubled in size in that time. Would it be possible to cut them right back? They are lovely and lots of birds nest in them, but I think they are too big now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicles are mounting the kerb to pass each other and damaging the kerbs and grass verges, 29th August
item.description:
Our lovely grass verges on Mead Road are being damaged by vehicles mounting the kerb to pass each other. These are usually/often HGVs from Travis Perkins' customers and vans from the industrial estate. Mead Road is overwhelmed by the goods traffic, which is dangerous in a residential street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking on the Mead Road/Churchill Road junction, 29th August
item.description:
Cars, vans and trucks are being parked on double-yellow lines all around the Mead Road/Churchill Road junction. They are also parked on the pavement, which blocks the pavement for wheelchairs and pushchairs. It's a busy junction and visibility is poor when vehicles are parked on the double yellow lines around and opposite the junction. The children go back to school soon and many cross the road at the Mead Road footpath, which is very close to this junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tall trees dangerous in high winds on Mead Rd path, 29th August
item.description:
On the right hand side of the first 100m of the footpath behind Mead Road there are some very tall trees. They sit between the footpath and Travis Perkins. In high winds they look very unstable and each winter they look more unstable with the summer's growth. We've lived here 12 years and they have at least doubled in size in that time. Would it be possible to cut them right back? They are lovely and lots of birds nest in them, but I think they are too big now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Line painting/bike lane needs redoing along Hall road, 29th August
item.description:
White line painting/bike lane needs redoing along lower part of Hall Road from the Arden Rd junction to Moorend Rd. Yellow lines also need repainting where the cars are parked. Causes obstruction and safety issues when cars turn onto hall road, especially during school drop offs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Hall Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The advertising sign takes up half of the pavement and on occasion I have had to walk on the high street with cars turning right on to St James Rd., 29th August
item.description:
The advertising sign for salt daddy, a pop up food stall, is restricting and obstructing the use of pedestrians, mobility scooters and pushchairs with a walking toddler. It is left out permanently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement
